titlePart.entryReference: layered materials, layered products in general

titlePart.text: BUILDINGS OR LIKE STRUCTURES FOR PARTICULAR PURPOSES

noteParagraph.text: This sub-class deals primarily with the layout of buildings as a whole, but includes details which are peculiar to types of buildings, or buildings for special purposes, specified in the groups. The word "buildings" does not exclude engineering structures and other erections.

titlePart.text: Buildings or groups of buildings for dwelling or office purposes
General layout, e.g. modular co-ordination, staggered storeys
titlePart.entryReference: buildings for two or more purposes, e.g. drive-in buildings,

titlePart.text: Apartment houses arranged in two or more levels

titlePart.entryReference: furniture or fittings for shops, storehouses, or the like

titlePart.text: Small buildings or other erections for limited occupation, erected in the open air or arranged in buildings, e.g. kiosks, waiting shelters for bus stops or for filling stations, roofs for railway platforms, watchmen's huts, dressing cubicles
Buildings or groups of buildings for public or similar purposes

titlePart.entryReference: portions of buildings for individual occupation, e.g. cubicles,
structures covering a large free area

titlePart.text: Restaurants or shops having arrangements for self-service
titlePart.entryReference: furniture or installations specially adapted for supermarkets

titlePart.text: Tribunes, grandstands or terraces for spectators
Devices for removal of polluted water
Devices for cleaning baths or for water treatment
Studios for broadcasting, cinematography, television or similar purposes
titlePart.entryReference: equipment for theatres or concert halls
devices for raising or lowering persons

titlePart.text: Buildings or groups of buildings for industrial or agricultural purposes
Buildings or groups of buildings for industrial purposes, e.g. for power-plants, factories
titlePart.entryReference: buildings forming part of cooling plants

titlePart.text: Pits or building structures for inspection or services
titlePart.entryReference: manhole shafts or other inspection chambers in general

titlePart.text: Buildings or groups of buildings for agricultural purposes
Buildings forming part of cooling plants
Buildings for parking cars, rolling-stock, aircraft, vessels, or like vehicles, e.g. garages
titlePart.entryReference: marking of parking areas on the ground

titlePart.text: Small garages, e.g. for one or two cars
titlePart.entryReference: attached to, or supported by, the vehicle

titlePart.text: wheeled, hinged, foldable, telescopic, swinging, or otherwise movable
titlePart.entryReference: transportable or collapsible buildings in general

titlePart.text: with means for shifting or lifting vehicles
without mechanical means for shifting or lifting vehicles, e.g. with helically-arranged fixed ramps, with movable ramps
with mechanical means for shifting or lifting vehicles
with endless conveyer chains having load-carrying parts moving vertically, e.g. paternoster lifts
Garages shaped as a wheel or drum rotable about horizontal axis
with means for transport in vertical direction only or independently in vertical and horizontal directions
characterised by use of conveyer chains or rotatable rollers for horizontal transport
characterised by use of movable platforms for horizontal transport
characterised by use of dollies for horizontal transport
characterised by use of tiltable floors for floor sections
characterised by use of movable ramps
characterised by use of turntables or rotary rings for horizontal transport
with means for transport in horizontal direction only
characterised by use of conveyer chains or rotatable rollers
characterised by use of movable platforms
characterised by use of freely-movable dollies
characterised by use of tiltable floors or floor sections
characterised by use of turntables or rotary rings
Devices or arrangements peculiar to garages, not covered elsewhere, e.g. securing devices, safety devices

titlePart.entryReference: structures covering a large free area

titlePart.text: Construction or assembling of bulk storage containers employing civil engineering techniques in situ or off the site
titlePart.entryReference: storage aspects, e.g. floating roofs, sealing means, filling or discharging means , , ,
arrangements or adaptations of tanks for water supply

titlePart.text: mainly of concrete, e.g. reinforced concrete, or other stone-like material
Containers for fluent solids, e.g. silos, bunkers
Constructions, with or without perforated walls, depending on the use of specified materials
mainly of concrete, e.g. reinforced concrete, or other stone-like material
Buildings, groups of buildings, or shelters, adapted to withstand or provide protection against, abnormal external influences, e.g. war-like action, earthquake, extreme climate
titlePart.entryReference: bearings or like supports allowing movement
special details regarding insulation or other protection
supporting structures for endangered or damaged existing buildings or parts thereof
cells or rooms shielded against dangerous radiation

titlePart.text: withstanding earthquake or sinking of ground
against air-raid or other war-like actions
Structures arranged in, or forming part of, buildings
Structures arranged underneath buildings, e.g. air-raid shelters
entirely underneath the level of the ground, e.g. air-raid galleries
against other dangerous influences, e.g. tornadoes, floods
against adverse conditions, e.g. extreme climate, pests

titlePart.entryReference: devices for erecting masts or poles
foundations for masts, poles, or chimneys

titlePart.text: of concrete or other stone-like material, with or without internal or external reinforcement, e.g. with metal coverings, with permanent form elements
movable or with movable sections, e.g. rotatable, telescopic
Side-supporting means therefor, e.g. using guy ropes, struts
titlePart.entryReference: fastening means for cables or ropes

titlePart.text: Sockets or holders for poles or posts
Chimney stacks, e.g. free-standing, or similar ducts
titlePart.entryReference: connections between furnace and smoke stack, chimney equipment

titlePart.text: Arrangements for erecting or lowering towers, masts, poles, chimney stacks, or the like
Buildings for combinations of different purposes not covered in a single preceding group of this sub-class, e.g. for double purpose

titlePart.entryReference: means for allowing passage through fences, barriers, or the like

titlePart.text: using wire, barbed wire, wire mesh, toothed strips, or the like

titlePart.entryReference: other metallic fabrics, see the relevant classes

titlePart.text: Anchoring means therefor, e.g. specially-shaped parts entering the ground
characterised by the way of connecting wire to the posts
the wire being placed in slots, grooves, or the like
Fences constructed of rigid elements, e.g. with posts, with additional wire fillings
using prefabricated panel-like elements, e.g. wired frames
Corrals, i.e. easly transportable or demountable enclosures
Anchoring means therefor, e.g. specially-shaped parts entering the ground
Connections for attaching additional wire to frames, posts or railings
Devices for erecting or removing fences.
